intro: Pedicularis cephalantha, commonly known as the helmeted lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often resembling small lanterns. Its leaves are alternate and often reduced, while its stems are wiry and can grow up to several feet in height. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
